loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is married and has one child. He lives with his family in the Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya. He produces cash crops and rears livestock.

He has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) for the purchase of a zero grazing unit and a chuff cutter. He says that this will improve their living standards. His vision is to have over twenty dairy cows in the next five years.

His major challenge is lack of capital and diseases.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Jose Julian

texts.es: Don José es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos es muy responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura lo que mas cosecha es maíz y frijol. José desea tener mas ganancias de sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, y todo lo necesario para su cosecha y asi poder seguir dandole lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Jose is a responsible man with household responsibilities.  He has always been known for providing the best for his children.  He currently lives with his wife and children and he is a resonsible and hardworking man.  He's a farmer and raises corn and beans.  Jose wants to have good profits from his sales, so he is asking for a loan which he will use to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and everything he needs for his harvest.  In this way he will be able to continue providing the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Hetem

texts.en:
Hetem is married. He lives with his wife and two children in the southern part. Over the years, he has made a living through farming. He began by buying a cow and sheep. Now he has multiplied the ones he has. Since then, he has seen his business grow and he is able to provide income for his family by producing and selling milk.  

To generate more income, Hetem also has another job. He works during the night as guard.  

Now Hetem  is requesting a loan to buy another cow. He wants to increase the number of cows on his farm, and believes that this business will help him to achieve his goals. He hopes to continue improving his living conditions and ensuring better education for his children. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 42 years old. She has been selling clothes and fabrics for the past 13 years. She is married with three children aged between 11 months and 15 years. Two of her children go to school. 

With the loan she has requested she will add more clothes. With the profits from the business she is planning to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is married, with six children. She sells beer and has been running this business for six years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees and providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has 7 children between 22 and 27. Her children are attending school, and only one lives at home.

For the past four years she has been selling charcoal by bags in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She spends 9 hours with her business and she is good at managing it. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC and promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 59 years old. She lives in Khoni district with husband, her 25-year-old son, and her 23-years-old daughter-in-law. Mariam requested loans from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family's poor living conditions.

Her family owns an agricultural plot of land where maize is grown. Also they have a milk cow. Mariam is milking the cow to make dairy products and sells them along with the harvested maize at the local markets.

Mariam requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the loan Mariam wants to start trading in household goods. She will go to the capital city to purchase stock at wholesale prices, bring it to her village and sell it with the price markup among her villagers. This business will bring good profits to Mariam's family. She plans to reinvest part of the profit in the same business and use another part for providing better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase household goods at the wholesale price

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 45 years old. She is married with nine children all aged between 9 and 24. Her husband owns a bar and they have been working in this business for five years. With the loan, she wants to add more sodas for sale in her shop. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more sodas for sale.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is appreciative of the last Kiva loan which enabled him to get good profits.

He is now requesting another loan of KES 50,000 to buy more clothes for sale and to buy more oranges, mangoes, and pawpaws to blend juice for sale, with the need of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale and to buy more oranges, mangoes, and pawpaws to blend juice for sale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 33 years old, single, and has two children who attend school. She has been an active farmer for over 15 years and grows cash crops.

Hellen is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 KES, which she will use to purchase 200 dairy goats. This project will help her to educate her children. Her challenge is lack of capital.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Don Marco Tulio tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive con su familia en una aldea de la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Don Marco siempre se ha dedicado a la actividad en trabajos de agricultura y albañileria. El es una persona muy trabajadora. hace 2 años implemento otra actividad productiva que le generara mejores ingreso, un negocio de cria y venta de cerdos, los cuales los comercializa a intermediarios y la paga es muy rentable.Este negocio lo ha mantenido activo gracias a la ayuda financiera que Odef le ha facilitado.Actualmente esta solicitando otro prestamo de 5000 lempiras para compra de alimento para los cerdos,esta inversion le ayudara a vender a mejor precio y sus ingresos seran mejores.El sueño de Don Marco es llegar a establecer una granja porqueriza de mayor productividad y mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio, 58, is married, has a son and lives with his family in a village in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Marco has always worked in agriculture and masonry. He is a very hardworking person. Two years ago, he started a business raising and selling pigs to generate a better income. He sells the pigs to intermediaries, which is very profitable. 

He has kept the business going thanks to the financial aid facilitated by ODEF. He is currently applying for another loan of 5000 lempiras to purchase food for the pigs. This investment will help him sell at the best price for a better income. Marco's dream is to establish a more productive pig farm and to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Raul Wilfredo

texts.es: Raul es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su hijo. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol. Raul desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar
texts.en:
Raúl is a very responsible man with household obligations because he is known for always giving his son the best.  Currently he lives with his wife and son and makes a living as a farmer, growing corn and beans.

Raúl wants to increase his sales so he has requested a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and other things to continue putting food on the table for his household.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 27 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for eight years. She wants the loan to buy more potatoes and bananas for sale. With the profits from the business, she will pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 31 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Her oldest child goes to school. 

She sells a variety of items in her shop.  With this loan, she wants to buy more rice, maize flour and tomatoes to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 39 years old.  She sells different types of vegetables and has requested a loan to purchase more eggplants, onions, carrots and tomatoes to sell.  She will save the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, onions, carrots and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married and has three children, all of whom are adults.  She resides in Chuka, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya.  She has been a farmer for over 30 years, growing cash crops.  In addition to farming, she also has a retail business.

Harriet’s main challenge is lack of capital.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase poultry birds.  Her future plan is to have over one hundred poultry birds. 

She expects that this will help her improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 56 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Pero solo vive con una hija y sus nietas. Desde hace aproximadamente siete años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas; empieza a las 6:00 a.m. y termina a las 2:30 a.m. actividad que realiza todos los días menos el domingo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 40 quintales de maíz y almacenarlos en dos silos, además, comprara dos quintales de cal hidratada para cocer el maíz, bebidas ya que esta iniciando con la instalación de una tienda en su casa. De esta manera, asegurara el maíz para no dejar de elaborar las tortillas, debido a que diariamente gasta una arroba y media. Así mismo, comprara insumos para iniciar con la tienda y desea que le vaya muy bien en ese nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old and has 2 children, but only lives with a daughter and her granddaughters. For approximately the last 6 years, she has been making and selling tortillas. She begins at 6:00 am and finishes at 2:30 pm. Rosa carries out this activity every day except Sunday.

The loan Rosa is soliciting through the Fundacion Campo is needed to buy 40 quintales (46 klgs. each) of corn, to be stored in 2 silos, and 2 quintales of dehydrated lime for cooking the corn, plus drinks. She is beginning to install a store in her house. In this manner, Rosa will be sure to have enough corn to guarantee that she will not have to halt tortilla making. Each day she uses 1 ½ arrobas (30 klgs. each) of corn. 

At the same time, Rosa will buy supplies for starting her store, since she wants things to go very well in this new store.

loans.use: to buy 40 quintales (46 klgs. each) of corn to be stored in two silos, plus 2 quintales of dehydrated lime for cooking corn, and also drinks, to begin installing a store in her house.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is very hardworking.  She appreciates the previous Kiva loan she received, which helped her very much.  She is now asking for another loan of 10,000 KES to buy more coconuts, cassavas and cooking oil so that she can have more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy coconuts,cassavas and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 47 years old and was born in Gyumri. She has daughter who graduated from Gyumri State Pedagogical University and a son who studies at the military academy. Nelli also graduated from GSPU. She then went to Vanadzor in order to teach mathematics and there she met her great love and was married.

Nelli has many years experience and a good reputation as a math teacher in Vanadzor. She also gives private math lessons. As her pupils confessed, she is very strict but she is good in her specialty. She is very knowledgeable in math, and they are very thankful to have her as a teacher.

Nelli is now applying for a 250,000 AMD loan through Nor Horizon to buy a computer. She will use it to make more stereometric lessons available to her pupils. (Stereometry is the process through which the volume and dimensions of a solid are determined.)

loans.use: to buy a computer to make lessons for her math classes.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 41 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 18 and 20, all of whom are in school and live at home. 

Norah has been selling used clothes from 2001 up to now. She started this business with a loan that she took from a savings club (group savings accounts), and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. 

In the near future, Norah wishes to build a house. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia and she promises to pay back her loan.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old. She has been selling shoes and men’s clothes for five years.  She is married with five children. 

With the loan, Mary wants to buy more men's clothes, such as trousers and shirts, for sale. With the profits from the business, she will reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more men's clothes for sale.

loans.name: Yurany

texts.es:
Yurany de 23 años se dedica desde hace ocho meses a la venta de productos por catálogo, principalmente para el cuidado personal y el hogar. Esta idea de negocios surgió debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para colaborar con los gastos del hogar. Hoy se siente satisfecha con su labor porque gracias a esta las condiciones de vida han mejorado.
Sueña con convertirse en una microempresaria y montar su propio local para generar mayores ingresos. Asegura que este será un proyecto a mediano plazo. Por lo cual desea enfocarse en la compra de mercancía para seguir aumentando sus ventas y colaborar en su hogar.
texts.en:
Yurany, 23, has made a living for eight months selling catalogue products, mainly personal care products and home products.  This business idea came up because she needed to generate income to contribute to the household expenses.  Today she's satisfied because her living conditions have improved thanks to her job.

She dreams of becoming a micro-entrepreneur and setting up her own space to generate more income.  She's certain this will be a medium-term project, so she wants to focus on buying merchandise to continue increasing her sales and contributing to her household.

loans.use: to buy staple products

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 37 years old and is married with five children. For the past eight years she has sold produce.

Clementine is applying for a 600,000 RWF loan through Urwego to buy extra bananas to sell. She will put her new profits into her business and savings.

loans.use: to buy extra bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is fifty years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a farmer in Chuka, a town in the Meru region of eastern Kenya. The family’s major challenge is a lack of money.

Jane is applying for a 60,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy goat. This investment will help to improve the family’s living standards. In the future she wants to buy a pickup truck to transport her goods to market.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en:
Yah is 46 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in Montserrado County, which is the largest commercial county in Liberia. She has been selling rice, oil, plantains, peanuts, and bananas for the past 15 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned the business from her aunt.   

Yah is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, oil, plantains, peanuts, and bananas for her business. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. In the near future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, plantains, peanuts, and bananas.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo, tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en una comunidad de Gracias, Lempira.
Gumercindo se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente, a la produccion y venta de cafe. El cual comercializa en pergamino y seco en el mercado local, y se lo pagan a buen precio. tiene diez años dedicado a esta actividad que desde entonces le ha generado los ingresos que ha necesitado para el sostenimiento de su familia.Lleva 3 prestamos consecutivos con Odef, y solicita el cuarto para compra de fertilizante, pago de mano de obra, para la asistencia de la finca.esta inversion le ayudara a mantener sus cultivos libre de plagas. El plan que tiene en el futuro es obtener el capital que le ayude a darle a sus hijos un nivel de educacion.
texts.en:
Gumercindo is 38 years old. He is married, has three children, and lives in a community in Gracias, Lempira.

Gumercindo earns his living in agriculture, in the production and sale of coffee, specifically. He sells his coffee dried and in parchment [a thin, papery skin still covering the beans after drying, but prior to roasting] in the local market, and he gets a good price for it. He has been in this business for ten years, and throughout that time, it has generated the income that he needs to sustain his family. 

Gumercindo has had three consecutive loans with ODEF, and he is requesting this fourth one to buy fertilizer and to pay for laborers to do farm work. This investment will help him to keep his crops free of disease. His plan for the future is to make money to help him give his children an education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for manual labor to help on the coffee farm.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 49 years old. She is a widow with two children, aged 20 and 23. They both go to school. 

Immaculee has been selling rice, sugar and flour for the past seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice and sugar for sale. 

The profits will be used for building a house, and she is aiming high for the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and flour for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en un sector de la Lopez Arellano, Choloma Cortes.
Don Jorge hace 5 años que realiza su propia actividad de negocio, su negocio consiste en la venta de productos lacteos, como mantequilla, queso(frijolero, crema), quesillo etc.Estos productos los comercializa de manera ambulante todos los dias en los alrededores de la ciudad. Esta contento ya que con las ventas de que hace le va muy bien tiene buena clientela, ademas cuenta con un proveedor que le facilita el producto a un precio mas comodo. El es un cliente muy responsable ya ha obtenido varios creditos con la Institucion. Nuevamente solicita otro de 11000 lempiras para invertir en comprar queso,mantequilla, quesillo etc.y otra parte la utilizara en el pago de factura pendiente al proveedor del producto,y no tener problema para seguir vendiendo. Su meta es seguir trabajando y tener como solventar cualquier problema economico que se le presente en el hogar.
texts.en:
Jorge is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in a sector of  Lopez Arellano, Choloma, in Cortes province.

Jorge began his own enterprise some 5 years ago. The business consists of selling milk products, such as butter, crumbling cheese, cream cheese, etc. He sells these products in the streets every day all around the city. Jorge is content because sales are going very well. He has a good clientele, and, besides, he can count on a provisioner who offers the products at a good price.

Jorge is a very responsible client who has obtained various loan with this Institution. Once again, he is soliciting a loan of 11,000 lempiras to invest in purchasing cheese, butter, cream cheese, etc. A 2nd part of the loan will be used to pay off a pending bill owed to his provisioner, in order to avoid having a problem that might threaten his sales.

Jorge's goal is to continue working and to have a means of solving whatever economic problem might occur in his home.

loans.use: to buy cheese, butter, cream cheese, and other milk products to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old, married and has one child. His family lives in Igoji on the northeast slopes of Mount Kenya in the Meru region of eastern Kenya. He has been a farmer for six years, growing bananas and tea and selling them in the local market. He faces the challenges of pests and diseases and a strong market for his produce.

David has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy poultry. This new venture should lift his family’s living standards. He hopes to buy a bigger piece of property.

loans.use: To buy poultry to raise.

loans.name: Margueritte

texts.en:
Margueritte is 42 years old. She is married with three children, and they all are enrolled in schools. 

With the loan, she will buy more potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah resides in Chuka, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She is 48 years old and is a single mother of two children, of whom one still attends school. 

Lydiah has been an active farmer of over 30 years, growing cash crops. She also operates a retail business to boost up her income.

She has requested a loan of KES 40,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase rabbits. In the future, Lydia wants to have a pick-up truck to help in her farming business. Her main challenge is a lack of capital.

loans.use: to buy rabbits.

loans.name: Georgine

texts.en:
Georgine is 31 years old. She is married with one child, aged 4 years. She sells different items in her boutique and has been in the business for five years. 

With the loan, Georgine wants to buy more sugar, maize flour, and soap for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize flour, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Divino Niño Sauce Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Nino el Sauce está conformado por 8 integrantes, siete mujeres y un hombre. Madres y padres solteros con 20 hijos  Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estos integrantes son personas, trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo cursar sus estudios,  y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad.

La coordinadora del banco comunal  es Rosa Melida la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de pago de las integrantes del banco comunal que lo realicen en tiempo  y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta pan de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, actividad. Ella dedica unas 8 horas diarias a ofrecer el pan con un canasto sobre la cabeza de unos 20 kg, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, porque es su medio de vida y la de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de pan variado para ofrecer a sus clientes como pico, semita, cachos, marquetas cortadas, polvorones, pan de especies, torta de pinas, rin. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Divino Nino Sauce agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño El Sauce communal bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man who are single parents with 20 children.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country.  These members are hardworking and responsible people with a desire for personal improvement.  Unfortunately none of them were able to study because they had to work from an early age.

The coordinator of the communal bank is Rosa Melida, who's responsible for making the bank members' payments punctually.  Her job is selling bread in the street and at home.  She works some eight hours a day selling her bread from a 20-kilogram basket on her head.  She does her job with great pleasure because it's how she supports herself and her children.

The goal of the loan is to invest in buying a variety of bread to sell to her customers, including rolls, sugar cookies, spice bread, and pineapple tarts.  This way she can have a better income in the near future.

The Divino Niño Sauce communal bank is grateful for the help Kiva investors give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have the means to a decent job.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bread

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy, de 33 años, es una valiente madre soltera, que cuida con mucho amor a su hija de 12 años. Con la que vive en casa de sus padres.Desde muy joven afronto muchas dificultades; pues tenía que hacer frente a las responsabilidades de ser mamá. Comenzando así desde hace 12 años a sembrar papa, alverja, habas y lechuga, en sus terrenos propios; que heredó de parte de sus padres. Todas las mañanas comparte sus actividades, ya que también se dedica a la ganadería, criando a los carneros, cerdos y vacas, que posee. Alimentándolos hasta que estén gordos, para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Asimismo prepara queso con la leche que produce las vacas, realizando de 2 a 4 moldes diarios, obteniendo una ganancia de S/. 30 a S/.40 soles a la semana. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de maíz y lechuga, que dentro de un mes extraerá de la tierra. Asegurando su buena venta, pues trabajó mucho en su cuidado. Este el cuarto préstamo con KIVA, y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe motivo por el cual se  compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Susy, invertirá los S/. 1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Susy is thirty-three years old and is a strong single mother.  She lovingly takes care of her twelve-year-old daughter, and they live together in her parents' home.  Since she was very young, she has faced many challenges; she had to face the responsibilities of being a young mother.

Twelve years ago, she began to grow potatoes, peas, beans, and lettuce on her own lands, which she inherited from her parents.  Every morning, she performs different tasks, since she also makes a living in livestock farming, raising the rams, pigs, and cows that she has; she feeds them until they are fat and later sells them at a better price.  She also makes cheese with the milk from the cows, making two to four molds per day and receiving a profit of 30 to 40 soles per week.  

Now, she is preparing for the corn and lettuce harvest.  Within one month, she will be collecting her crops and she ensures that she will have a good sale, since she worked with a lot of care.  

This is her fourth loan with KIVA, and she is very thankful for the financial support that she has received; this is her motivation for promising to be punctual with her payments.  

Susy will invest the 1500 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is 33 years old, married and has five children between five and fourteen years old. All of her children attend school and live at home. The family lives in Gardnersville in the Greater Monrovia district of Liberia.

Teta has been selling charcoal for the past seven years. She started doing so with money given to her by her mother, and she learned how to sell from her friends. She says her main business challenge is transportation costs.

Teta is applying for a 12,000 LRD loan through BRAC Liberia to buy extra charcoal and so increase her sales. What makes her proud and happy is making the money that enables her to take care of her children and herself. Her future plans include building a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy extra charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee, a 38-year-old mother of six children, is married to a teacher. Consolee sells a variety of items in her boutique, which she has been running for seven years. With this loan, she wants to buy more salt, maize flour and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be put toward savings.

loans.use: To buy more salt, maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and roofing timbers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 25 years old, and lives in Montserrado County, which is has the largest free-port and is the number-one commercial county in Liberia. Josephine completed tenth grade, and she is single with two children aged 5 and 8. They are in school and live at home. For the past six years, Josephine has been selling hair grease, body cream, soap, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She spends five hours a day and is good at managing her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more hair grease, body cream, soap, etc. for her business. Her plans is to build a house for her children. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia and promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more hair grease, body cream, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is a young female Cameroonian living in an urban center.  She is 28 years old, unmarried, and has an 8-month old child. She has been in the call box business for over four years which makes her experienced, successful and stable.  Besides the call box business she also sell items like sachet milk, sweets and bon bons, biscuits and omo. This loan will enable her to increase her stock by about 30% and hence her output and standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to buy air time for her call box business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de 57 años de edad , esta casado con Rayda, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en un caserio.  Con la sonrisa que siempre lo caracteriza, cuenta que desde hace 28 años se dedica a la agricultura y siembra papa, alverja, lechuga, habas y zanahoria; pero lo que más siembra son las hortalizas, porque le cuestan más y le ofrecen mayores ganancias. Además cuenta que vende su producción después de cada cosecha al mercado mayorista de su ciudad, pero si el precio de venta es muy bajo, viaja a la capital del país a vender sus productos, ganando así un precio mayor. Asimismo se dedica a la ganadería donde cuida de las vacas, toretes, burros, carneros, cerdos ,los cuales después de engordarlos los comercializan a un mayor precio . Su principal dificultad es no tener un capital de trabajo propio, por ello que se ayuda con la venta de sus animalitos, comenta. Es así que más adelante desea mejorar el cuidado de sus animales.Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA,motivo por el cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  
Manuel, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Manuel is fifty-seven years old and is married to Rayda.  Together, they have four children, but only two of their children still live at home.  They live in a very small village.

With the smile that he is characterized as always having, he says that for 28 years, he has made a living in agriculture, growing potatoes, peas, lettuce, beans, and carrots.  What he grows the most of are garden vegetables, since they cost more and offer the best profits.  He says that he sells his crops after each harvest at the wholesale market in the city.  However, if the selling price is very low, he travels to the capital city to sell his products, offering him a better price.  He also makes a living in livestock farming, caring for cows, bulls, donkeys, rams, and pigs.  After fattening the animals, he sells them for a better price.  

His main challenge is not having his own working capital; he comments that the sale of his animals helps with this, and it is for this reason that he hopes to improve the care of his animals in the future.  

This is his fifth loan with KIVA, and he therefore promises to be punctual with his payments.

Manuel will invest the 2500 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 53-year-old responsible woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and five children. Since 2002, she and her husband have been in the cloth business. Three of her sons are currently enrolled in a government school, and two sons are working in a woodshop. 

Anwar has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand the cloth business. The main purpose of the loan is to buy a large quantity and new variety of cloth at a cheaper rate, and then sell it at a profit. The current stock is almost finished, and a new variety is needed to continue her business. 

Anwar would save some money from the profit amount and pay the educational expenses of her children. She has a bright vision, and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 27 years old. She is married to a motorcyclist, and they have one child. Gloria sells shoes, and with this loan is planing to add more shoes to her inventory. She has been in the business for one year. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business and savings.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 23-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband. Her husband is working in a marble factory, and he is a heart patient. Sumaira is much worried about his health, as they have no funds available for his treatment. 

Sumaira is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2010, she has been operating her own beauty salon very efficiently. Currently, the beauty stock of the salon is almost finished. Therefore, Sumaira wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and some other variety of products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. She will save the profit amount for the treatment of her husband. 

Sumaira dreams to live a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her husband. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Pervaizan

texts.en:
Pervaizan is a 57-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and nine children in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2002, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. Due to the large family size and low monthly income, they are facing many problems. Her husband needs additional capital for the growth of his business. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can invest in her husband’s shop.

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods like rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk and utility items for his general store to fulfill the demand of customers and to increase his savings for the better future of their children. The profit amount would be used to expand the business and pay the household expenses.

Pervaizan and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family, and they are very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Gulnaz Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 55-year-old hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons, and two daughters. Three of her children are currently studying in primary school. Her husband is an electrician. Due to their low income, they are facing many problems in life. It’s very difficult for Gulnaz to keep the education of her children continued because of the huge educational expenses.

Gulnaz is working hard to meet the family’s needs by stitching clothes. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 7 years. She is very experienced in the stitching and sewing of dresses, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Gulnaz, as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future, and her production will be increased. She can stitch more dresses in less time with a new machine. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to expand her business and provide quality education to her children. With the profit she is planning to open a tailoring centre for girls. Gulnaz and her family are very thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

Note: In the picture, Gulnaz is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to stitch more dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 40-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and one son. Her husband is a security guard by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. For the past four years, he has been driving a taxi at night, but he is currently not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired.
 
Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to repair the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Shehnaz desires to provide a quality education to her son, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi engine

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 26 years old. She is married with two children. 

Epiphanie sells potatoes and has been in the business for one year. Her husband works with her in the same business. 

The profits from the business will be used for re-investing into the business.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 28 years old, and is single. He sells different items in his store. 

With the loan, he wants to buy more items such as peanuts and maize flour to sell. The profits from his business will be used to make more savings for the better future of his business.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and maize flour to sell in his store.

loans.name: Drocelle

texts.en:
Drocelle is 23 years old. She is married and she has one baby boy, who she is holding in the photo. 

She sells various items and has been in her business for five years. With the loan, she will add more cooking oil and salts to her business to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and salts to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 42 years old. She is married with ten children. She sells cows and has been doing this for four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more cows to sell. The profits from her business will be put towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie is 26 years old. She sells different items in her mini supermarket. Her husband is a truck mechanic. 

She wants the loan to buy various snack and beverages to sell in the supermarket. She is expecting to pay school fees for the children with the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and beverages to sell in her mini supermarket.

loans.name: Ricardo Enrique

texts.es: Don ricardo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Ricardo has earned his living farming for many years, growing beans and corn. With the sale of his harvests, he manages to cover the costs of his household. 

Ricardo is a responsible man, honest and hardworking. He lives with his wife and their four children. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy supplies for his crops, since with what he earns, he can't afford to cover these costs. Buy purchasing these supplies, he will have better income and improved economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more corn to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 35 years old and lives with her boyfriend and three children. The children are aged between 7 and 13, and all of them attend school. She lives in Margibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia.

For eight years now, Marie has been selling soap in her community. She started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend. Marie makes a good profit and is getting more and more customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy more soap for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more soap for her business.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 25 years old. He is married to a farmer and they both have one child. 

Anastase has been selling foodstuffs for seven years. With the loan, he plans to add more salt, sugar, and cooking oil to his store. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and coooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 30 years old. He owns a restaurant and has been in the business for ten years. 

With the loan, he wants to buy more foodstuffs to sell, such as beans and sorghum. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

In the photo, Jerome holds a passbook.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 61 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su menor hijo al que educa en la casa que le heredaron sus padres hace 30 años. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a preparar platos típicos en su casa; el cual acondicionó como un restaurante; comenta que los fines de semana es donde más intensifica sus ventas, también  tiene  pedidos de su clientela para cubrir banquetes en eventos sociales  que se producen en su ciudad como fiestas de cumpleaños, recepciones, matrimonios, aniversarios, etc. Afirma que el trabajo es arduo, pues la preparación de alimentos requiere de mucha dedicación, para ella es una gran satisfacción dedicarse a lo que considera su pasión, además las ganancias que percibe compensan su esfuerzo por lo que se ha propuesto mejorar su cocina con mejores platos, sobre todo porque la comida peruana se encuentra en su máximo auge y quiere contribuir con sus secretos culinarios.Lidia, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para la preparación de los alimentos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite y demás.
texts.en: Lidia is 61 years old and is a very hardworking woman and lives with her oldest son whom she homeschools.  She inherited here home from her parents 30 years ago and has been preparing typical dishes in her home for the past 12 years.  She set up a restaurant and says that her sales increase on the weekends.  She also gets requests from her customers to cover banquets and social events in town, such as birthdays, receptions, weddings, anniversaries, etc.  She says that the work is hard because the preparation of the food requires much attention.  For her it’s a great satisfaction to dedicate herself to what she believes to be her passion.  The earnings also compensate for her effort and she proposes to improve her cooking with better dishes, mainly because the Peruvian food is popular and she wants to contribute her culinary secrets.  Lidia will use the money from this loan of 500 PEN to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other things.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Johana Matilde

texts.es:
Su nombre es JOHANA, tiene 19 años de edad
Estudie en el colegio donde se gradué y termino sus estudios para  dar un  gran comienzo a la educación superior, para esto tomo un tiempo y paciencia debido a razones económicas no le era posible lograrlo. Así pasaron 3 años hasta que por fin pudo hacer este sueño realidad gracias a las facilidades de pago que le ofrecen, y sus costos moderados, haciendo posible su desarrollo en el campo profesional.
 Ahora se encuentra estudiando en primer semestre de AD.HOTELERA Y TURÍSTICA ha obtenido grandes conocimientos y buen nivel académico ya que es lo que siempre le ha apasionado estudiar; le gusta mucho ser interactiva con las personas, compartir ideas, conocer y así crecer cada vez más laboral-mente en este ámbito. Hace esto parte en su proyecto de vida.
Piensa en profesionalizar su carrera para tener firmes los conocimientos y tener buena estabilidad laboriosamente, aprender idiomas y tener un manejo excelente de este. Un poco de gastronomía, hasta llegar a hacer lo que siempre ha proyectado a futuro una buena hotelera con suficientes conocimientos y facultades para así crear su propio hotel , o club y brindar a las demás personas una estabilidad económica ofreciéndoles oportunidad de trabajo. Todo esto como logros a cumplir y visiones a seguir.
Por ahora le serviría de gran ayudaría el proyecto “KIVA” ya que no cuenta económicamente con los medios suficientes, también a seguir con sus expectativas y su proceso de formación .Espera que todo esto se vuelvan metas con la ayuda de ustedes gracias.
texts.en:
Johana, 19, graduated from high school and finished her studies so she could start her higher education.  For economic reasons this took some time and patience, and it wasn't possible for her to achieve it.  Three years went by before she could manage to make her dream a reality thanks to the payment terms they offer and the moderate cost, making her professional development possible.

Now she's in the first semester of hotel administration and tourism.  She has learned a lot and achieved a good academic level because it's what she has always wanted to study.  She very much likes to interact with people, share ideas, and learn, and this way grow more all the time in terms of work in this field.  She does this as part of her life project.

She plans to become a professional and have a solid knowledge and good work stability, to study languages and have an excellent command of them, and to study gastronomy a little.  This way she can do what she has always planned for the future--be a good hotelier with sufficient knowledge and abilities to create her own hotel or club and give other people economic stability by offering them the opportunity of a job.  All these plans are achievements to accomplish and visions to follow.

For now, the Kiva project would be a big help to her because she doesn't have enough money to continue with her expectations and her training.  She hopes all this turns into goals with your help.  Thank you.

loans.use: to finish her academic program

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es: Ileana, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y  su hijo los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos químicos, y semilla de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener y utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ileana is 22 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son who are her main priorities in life.  She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and other chemical products.  She will also buy good-quality seed and pay laborers to apply the products and help tend her crops.  This will enable her to ensure a good job.

Ileana plans to make the most of the good weather and soil that she has for this sowing season.  She will put into practice the experience that she has gained from several years growing basic grains.  She will be able to buy better quality products so that her crops grow in a healthy manner.  This will provide her with a decent yield in the short term.

Ileana plans to spend the income that she makes from her future harvest on her family's well-being and education, and to fulfill some family goals.  She will also continue investing in her crops.  This is the first loan that Ileana has received from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn't received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her bean crops

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 33 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is married with five children, aged between 1 and 11 years old. All of her children attend school.

Although Hawa was unfortunate not to attend school when she was younger, she is a potential business woman. Over the past few years, she has being selling charcoal in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount that she got from her husband. She sells charcoal everyday, spending 12 hours in her business. To help her business, she is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

Her partner is not working, and in spite of this, she manages her business well.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 28 years old. She owns a salon and has been running the business for five years. She is married to a businessman and they have two children. 

She would like a loan to buy shampoo, and other different products for use in the salon. With the profits from the business, Francoise wants to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more products to use in her salon.

loans.name: Meme

texts.en:
Meme is 49 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a well known and populated area in Montserrado County. 

She is a widow with children aged between 22 and 32 years old. One of the children is in school while the other is working. 

Meme is not educated, but is a very good business manager. She has been selling water and soft drinks for the past 16 years, without encountering major problems. The business emerged from the monthly earnings of her son. She is requesting a loan so tha she can increase her business, which will enable her to send her child to school.

loans.use: to increase her business, which will enable her to send her child to school.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 35 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is well known in Montserrado county. She is a widow with five children, aged between 12 and 20 years old. All of her children attend school and live at home with their mother. 

Aminata sells used clothes in the local market every day. Her business is well managed. She has been selling the goods for the past five years without any serious problems. She started this business with income generated from her underclothes business.

Now, she is requesting a loan to promote and increase her business. She plans to build a good foundation for her children.

loans.use: to promote and increase her business.

loans.name: Evaliste

texts.en: Evaliste is 32 years old. He is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. With the loan, he wants to add more equipment for use in his barber shop. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more equipment to use in the barber shop.

loans.name: Emerine

texts.en: Emerine is aged 30 years. She has one child, and she is married to a soldier. She sells clothes and has been in the business for three years. With the loan, she wants to add more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase the output.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Eleodora Elizabeth

texts.es: Eleodora de 54 años de edad se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos en su lugar de residencia tiene 20 años de estar comercializando esos productos y ha tenido buenos resultados con sus ventas, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo, hijo y nuera quienes ayudan en los gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder surtir mas su negocio con cremas, perfumes y de todo tipo de maquillaje y asi poder tener mas ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Eleodora is 54 years old and her business is selling cosmetics from home.  She has been selling this type of product for 20 years and has done well in her business.

Eleodora lives in her own home together with her husband, son and daughter-in-law who help with the household expenses.  She is requesting a loan so that she can further stock her business with creams, perfumes and all kinds of make-up.  This will enable her to make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 64-year-old, married man who has four children. He lives in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is selling herbal medicine, and he has a number of loyal customers. His major challenge is inadequate capital to refine more medicine and meet the high demand. His dream is to have an herbal research center. Like all good fathers, his dream is to see all his children attain degrees, so as to help him with their expertise, and also to train their hands, as a continuity business strategy.

Ismail intends to use the loan facility to buy raw materials for herbal medicine to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a tractor, drip irrigation lines, and plastic sheeting.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.es: Eduard, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa y la cual  es su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos químicos como también la semilla, además pagar mano de obra para la siembra y asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de estas plantas. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener y utilizarla en el bienestar  de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Eduard, age 28, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his wife, and she is his greatest priority.

He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers, other chemical products, and seeds.  He will also pay for the labor to sow and tend to the plants.  This way he will make sure that he does a good job.  

He is trying to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions that he has for this crop.  He will also put into practice his several years of experience managing these plants.

In addition to being able to buy the best products and the best quality for his plants, they will develop well, and they will be healthy.  He will have a suitable production in the short term.

He will use the income from the harvest that he hopes to have for his family’s well-being.  He will also meet some family goals and continue investing more in the crops.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He had no previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR gave the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow ginger.

loans.name: Erick Marcelo

texts.es: Erick Marcelo, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en la preparación del terreno. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar una siembra y así tener una buena densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Erick Marcelo is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his highest priority.  With this loan, he intends to purchase fertilizers, fungicides and pay for manual labor to prepare the soil.  He will also be able to purchase seedbed plants which will allow him to have a higher density of plants in each area.  He will also be able to take advantage of the fertile soil and the climate which are ideal for growing coffee. 
With these improvements to his crop, he hopes to increase his earnings and in so doing improve the living conditions of his family, invest a little more in his growing area and meet some of his goals.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Prior to this he had not had any other loans in national banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, fungicides and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 30-year-old, hardworking woman, who has four children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling second-hand shoes, and she also raises pigs to boost her income. She faces a challenge of customers not paying on time. Her vision is to buy land, build a good house for her residence, and expand her shoe business to new areas. Lucy intends to use the loan to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 43-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Thirteen years ago he decided to start a retail shop in order to earn money to support his family. Like most traders, he faces the challenges of price fluctuations and high license fees.

Deo intends to use this loan to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell. His dreams are to educate his children and own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 40-year-old, married man, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He is a carpenter who is gifted in making furniture of all designs, thus attracting a lot of customers. Like all business, he has faced hardships of inadequate capital to meet the demand and price fluctuations, while his dream is to own a showroom in the city center. 

Deo intends to use the loan to buy timber to make furniture.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday, a 32-year-old father of two living in Fort Portal, Uganda, operates a pork joint and makes bricks in order to support his growing family. Unpredictable weather changes and the high cost of pigs affect his profits.

Sunday is requesting this loan to buy more pigs for slaughter and to construct a shelter for his customers. His dreams are to build a good residential house, establish a poultry business and expand his brick-making enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for slaughter and to construct a shelter.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used the previous loan to buy maize to sell. He is a 41-year-old, married man, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children to attain degrees. 

Patrick has been running an agriculture produce business for the last six months and the business is steadily growing. He faces the hardship of inadequate capital to purchase stock, while his vision is to diversify his business to include farming, which he has already started, and to expand to new markets. 

Patrick intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 45-year-old, hard-working woman, living in Fort Portal Uganda. She has a number of businesses, which include poultry farming and a restaurant. With the proceeds, she has also been able to build a rental house to earn more income. She says that she is hindered by inadequate capital to realize all her dreams, while her plans are to complete construction of her house and to own a modern restaurant.

Gladys intends to use the loan to buy building materials and also rent more decent premises for her restaurant business, so as to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy building materials and also to rent more decent premises for her restaurant business, so as to attract more customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman, who has four children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a tailor. Over time, with her profits, she has been able to build rental houses, the rents from which now supplement her income.

Customers who don't pay on time and stiff competition pose challenges to her business growth. Her dream is to own a fashion school. Elizabeth is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy materials for making school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy materials for making school uniforms

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 33-year-old, hard-working woman, with three children, living in Fort Portal ,Uganda. She sells second-hand shoes and the business has been very lucrative. Unpredictable weather changes affect her business since she operates in the open, while her dreams are to move to sheltered business premises, to buy a plot, and to build a house. 

Annet is requesting a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela, age 50, is a married woman and has three children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business selling spare parts in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Angela requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional spare parts and tools to sell.

She would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and tools to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 51 years old, married, and has nine children, three of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, hog raising in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Carolina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She will use the loan to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF, to finance her business activity.

She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Charisse

texts.en:
Charisse works hard to support her family. She has a business selling cellular phones and accessories in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Charisse requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional inventory to sell at her shop.

She would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell at her mobile phones and accessories shop

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cristita is 32 years old, and two of her children are in school. Cristita has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. Cristita applied for a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. Cristita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money to expand her business and purchase a delivery truck.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jinefer

texts.en:
Jinefer, 44, is a married woman, and she has two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. 

Jinefer requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs, and additional piglets to raise. She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her pig-raising business.

She would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, todos maiores, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ela.
É avicultora, vende frangos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vitaminas, e outros), para aumentar o volume de criação de frangos.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio, e ser uma grande avicultora, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para atingir as suas metas.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has five children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a house that she owns and she also supports two grandchildren who live with her.
She's a poultry farmer. With the current loan she intends to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business and become a great poultry farmer. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is not having enough funds to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Emilia applied for a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell. Emilia has been in this business for eleven years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Emilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Ignacia applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall. Ignacia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ignacia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 32 years old, married, and has three children, who are in school. Ma. Gina is in an agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for two years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan funds to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has borrowed three times from NWTF before this loan, to finance her business activity.

Ma. Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mariziel

texts.en:
Mariziel works hard to support her family. Mariziel is married and has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her vegetable-farming business.

Mariziel would like to save enough money so that in the future, she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.  
É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, arroz, peixe, amendoim, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio, e dar continuidade a obra da sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para dar continuidade a sua obra.
texts.en:
Alice is married and has two children who attend school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (flour, rice, fish, peanuts, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business and to keep on remodeling her house. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is not having enough funds to continue remodeling her house.

loans.use: to purchase goods (flour, rice, fish, peanuts, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise.

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es: Francisco Rene es un hombre de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos, es originario del departamento de Chinandega. Hace diez años tuvo la iniciativa de iniciar un negocio de venta de mercadería en general de forma ambulante, trabaja arduamente ya que  realiza sus ventas en diferentes municipios del departamento; su esposa es empleada doméstica, trabajo que es muy duro y muy mal remunerado, razón por la cual Francisco quiere aumentar el capital de su negocio para incrementar sus ventas y que no sea necesario que su esposa se dedique a esa labor  tan dura. Francisco solicita el crédito para poder comprar artículos como ropa, cosméticos, adornos y joyería. Su mayor sueño es realizar mejoras en su vivienda, pero primordialmente que sus hijos puedan formarse profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Francisco Rene is a 44-year-old married man with two children.  He is from the district of Chinandega.  Ten years ago he took the initiative to start a business selling merchandise door-to-door.  He works hard, making his sales in different cities in the area.  His wife is a domestic employee, which is very hard work that pays very little.

For this reason Francisco wants to increase his inventory of goods so that he can make more sales, so that his wife will not have to be employed in such a difficult job.  

He is seeking this loan in order to buy items such as clothing, cosmetics, jewelry and accessories.  His greatest dream is to make improvements to his home, but first and foremost he hopes that his children can have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, jewelry and other accessories.

loans.name: Villistas Group

texts.es: Villistas es un grupo integrado por 8 mujeres trabajadoras, llamado así por que son muy mexicanas y como Francisco Villa son muy luchistas. Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Ma Juana, una mujer madura de 56 años de edad, casada y con 2 hijos muy buenos; se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en mercados rodantes, tiene mas de 15 años siendo comerciante y sus hijos la ayudan a moverse en camioneta a los diferentes mercados; el crédito la ayudara a surtir mas ropa para vender. Ma Juana desea seguir creciendo con su negocio y conservando su crédito. Ella menciona que son un grupo muy unido y muy buenas vecinas, se conocen desde casi 30 años, ya que viven en la misma colonia.
texts.en:
Villistas is a group consisting of 8 hard-working women, so called because they are very Mexican and like Francisco Villa they strive hard. 

One of the members of this group is Ma Juana, a mature woman, 56 years of age, married with 2 very good children. She works selling new and used clothing in travelling markets. She has been a trader for more than 15 years and her children help her to drive the truck to different markets. 

The loan will help her to supply more clothes to sell. Ma Juana wants to continue to grow her business and maintain her loan. She says that they are a close-knit group and very good neighbours. They have known each other for almost 30 years, since they live in the same residential zone.

loans.use: to supply new clothing.

loans.name: Florvelyn

texts.en: Florvelyn intends to improve her business to make it a convenient source of income. She is 38 years old and has three children. To improve her business, Florvelyn is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy two bales of “ukay-ukay” (imported used clothes). She hopes that her requested loan will be approved. This will greatly help improve her business, and she hopes that she will be successful for the sake of her children.

loans.use: to buy two bales of “ukay-ukay” (imported used clothes)

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Pedrita works hard to support her family.

She has a cellular phone repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of cellular phone accessories. Pedrita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her cellular phone repair shop business.

Pedrita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Restituta has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Restituta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and purchase a delivery truck in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 57 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Veronica has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farm.

Veronica has been in this business for 15 years. Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Los Progresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es: Saludos cordiales. El grupo “Los Progresistas De Cupiche” está integrada por 08 socios comprometidos que siguen mejorando cada día con el único fin de apoyar a sus familias. Ynes es una de las fundadoras del grupo y tesorera  cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Ella tiene 42 años de edad casada con 02 hijos aún dependientes. Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos en hilo y lana, para estar mejor capacitada  asiste a unos talleres que brinda la institución. Ynes es muy buena para los tejidos, tal lo demuestra ya que tiene varios pedidos. Su mayor deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales es por ello que se esfuerza. El crédito que solicitó lo invirtió para la compra de hilos y lana en mayor cantidad, ya que le sale económico. El grupo “Los Progresistas De Cupiche” agradecen el crédito, pues hace posible su progreso. Ynes es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo rosado y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
