In his spare time, he likes to keep working and sometimes he cooks delicious "Arroz Chaufa" to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Cesar works as a motorcycle taxi driver, providing transport services in his city. He works every day for about 12 hours. He believes he is doing well due to his responsibility and the kind treatment he gives to others.

Cesar is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help provided he will be able to have the renovation and general maintenance that his motorcycle taxi needs. This way, Cesar will have his vehicle in top condition and he will be able to keep providing his services. Therefore, he will keep working to achieve his dream of having his own car.

loans.use: in the renovation and general maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is a friendly middle-aged woman. She has 35 years old. She got married many years ago and has three children. She’s really proud of her family and ready to do her best to be able to offer them a respectable life.  Since their marriage, Ola’s husband used to manage the family expenses and still does. And since Ola noticed that their income do not satisfy their needs, she decided to open her own clothing shop. She sells a wide variety of clothes from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. To better develop her work, she’s requesting today a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts, lingerie, and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts, lingerie, and many other items

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is a friendly Lebanese woman. She is 25 years-old and lives with her father and two siblings. She’s really proud of her family and ready to do her best to be able to offer them a respectable life. Since she noticed that her father’s income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to open her own lingerie shop with the small amount of money she already has. She sells a wide variety of women's lingerie from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. To better develop her work, she’s requesting today a youth loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to enlarge her business by adding diverse items to it. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to enlarge her business by adding diverse items to it.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru: Башорату 51 года. Она добрая и толерантная женщина. Башорат за мужем и имеет 1 ребенка, которому 16 лет. Башорат еще в молодости научилась у портнихи шить женские одежды. Она обучилась в Педагогическом Университете. Данное время она работает в средней школе учительницей. Она получает маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она должна упорно работать и получать больше дохода, так как ее муж без рабочий и со всеми расходами Башорат справляется сама. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых  женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки тканей для организации нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bashorat is 51 years old, married, and has one 16-year-old child. She is a kind and tolerant woman. When she was young, she studied with seamstresses who taught her how to sew women's clothing. She also graduated from the Pedagogical University. She currently works as a high school teacher, but her salary is very low and is not sufficient to provide for her family. She wants to set up her own business sewing women's clothing. She has to work very hard and earn a good income because her husband is unemployed, so she needs to cover all expenses herself. She took a course entitled "To Get Ahead" that was organised by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she earned a certificate. She is seeking a loan of 1,000 Tajikistan Somoni to purchase fabrics so she can establish her business. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for to set up a new business

loans.name: Durdona

texts.ru: Дурдоне 34 года. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Она живет вместе с мужем в сельской местности. Дурдона уже более 12 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, морковь, ячмень и т.п. Ее муж помогает ей введение бизнеса. Она хочет развивать бизнес, увеличить доход и таким образом получить шанс помочь бездомным детям. Она очень любит детей и желает им добра. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения и семена для развития сельхоз бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Durdona is 34 years old. She is married but does not have children. She and her husband live in a rural area. For over 12 years, she has been earning a living by growing crops like potatoes, carrots, barley, and so on. Her husband helps in her work. She now wants to develop her business and increase her income, which will give her the opportunity to help homeless children. She really loves kids and wishes the best for them. Durdona is seeking a loan of 6,000 Tajikistan Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the development of her agricultural business. She is waiting for your kindness and promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rafael Julian

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Rafael no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rafael trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente trabaja con el apoyo de su esposa vendiendo sandias, Rafael trabaja todos  los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rafael se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina y una mesa, las cuales le servirán de mucho para acondicionar su negocio de venta de sandias, de esta manera Rafael podrá brindar un mejor servicios y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rafael, 41, lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial District, together with his wife and two childen who he loves very much and who are his main motivation in life.  He is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who, alongside his wife, dedicates all his efforts to providing for the family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to start work from a very early age, Rafael was unable to get a degree in Agronomy.  In his free time he likes to read and, sometimes, cooks a delicious Ceviche to share with family.

On his own initiative and with much tenacity and dedication, Rafael works as a field worker on a farm in his city.  He also helps his wife sell watermelons.  Rafael works every day for approximately ten hours; and he believes things are going well because of his responsibility and kindness toward others.

Rafael is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy a display case and table to fix up his watermelon stall.  This will allow Rafael to provide better customer service and continue working toward his goal of finishing the construction of his house.

loans.use: To buy a display case and table.

loans.name: Jhonatan Octavio

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Jhonatan pudo estudiar una pequeña carrera técnica de Electricidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jhonatan trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jhonatan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, en el cual brindará servicios de reparación de artefactos eléctricos, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is 19, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings.  He is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who is determined to get ahead.   Through his own efforts and with the support of his parents, Jhonatan was able to study to be an electric technician.  In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer; and sometimes he cooks a delicious chicken and rice to share with family.

On his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Jhonatan works as a motortaxi driver in the city.  He works an average 12 hours a day and believes business is going well because he is responsible and kind toward others.

Jhonatan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a small sales stall in the central market of the city.  There he plans to offer repair services for electric applicances.  This will allow him to continue working toward his goal of having his own company.

loans.use: To buy a sales stall.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Don Rafael de 37 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 8, 10, 11 y 13 años, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes y herramientas para su cultivo de maiz y frijol, para poder seguir dandole el sustento diario a su familia y poder solventar todos los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Rafael, 37, lives with his wife and four children, ages 8, 10, 11 and 13.  He grows corn and beans for a living.  He is a very hard-working, responsible person regarding his household obligations and is known for giving his children the best he can.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and tools for his corn and bean crops.  This is so he can continue providing for his family on a daily basis and take care of household expenses.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco es un comerciante muy trabajador y emprendedor. El tiene un negocio de cerrajería y es muy conocido en la localidad; siempre busca ofrecer a sus clientes la mejor tecnología para poder estar a la vanguardia. El siempre busca satisfacer a sus clientes y entregarles las llaves bien hechas y de buena calidad. El Sr. Francisco necesita de nuestra ayuda para poder comprar una computadora más nueva, ya que la otra que tenía se encuentra muy deteriorada.
texts.en: Francisco is a hard-working, enterprising merchant who runs a very popular locksmithing business in his town.  He always offers his customers the best technology available, in an effort to be in the vanguard.  He strives to satisfy his customers and provide them with well-made, high quality keys.  Francisco needs help in buying a newer model computer because the one he has is very old.

loans.use: To buy a computer for his locksmithing business.

loans.name: Mario Israel

texts.es: Don Mario se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas a la agencias de granos basicos logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Mario has been a farmer for several years growing beans and corn.  With the money he makes from selling his crops to the basic grain agencies, he is able to cover household expenses.  He is a responsible, honest, hard-working man who lives with his wife and two children.  He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies for his crops since the money he earns is not enough to cover these expenses.   This will allow him to improve his income and achieve more economic stability.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Emir

texts.es: Emir tiene 38 años de edad, su compañera le ayuda en el negocio, la cual consiste en la compra y venta de de cemento que va a vender fuera de Managua, con estos ingresos ayuda a sus cuatro hijos para que estudien y no les falte lo primordial la alimentación. Esta es la primera vez que Emir está solicitando crédito con Afodenic, para construir un segundo piso en su casa de habitación, para esto necesita comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, plycem para las divisiones, cemento, arena, bloques, hierro entre otros materiales, esto le permitirá más comodidad para vivir con su hermosa familia.
texts.en:
Emir is 38 years old. He works together with his partner buying cement and selling it outside Managua and this is how he pays for his four children’s food and education.

This is Emir’s first loan with AFODENIC; he is planning to build a second floor in his house and he needs to buy zinc sheets, beams, panels for the divisions, cement, sand, bricks and iron, among other materials. This will give him and his beautiful family a more comfortable place where to live.

loans.use: to buy building materials like zinc sheets, cement, sand, bricks and iron.

loans.name: Yolanda Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Yolanda de 33 años se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 12 años cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza ha podido sacar adelante a su familia ya que le genera buenas ganancias, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa propia, Yolanda solicita credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia ( pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa para bebe, etc) y asi surtir mas su venta y seguir teniendo mejores ganancias para poder seguir manteniendo su estabilidad economica como hasta ahora.
texts.en: Yolanda is 33 years old. She has sold clothing for 12 years close to her residence. With the sales she has been able to get her family ahead, because they bring in good earnings. She lives with her husband and son in a home they own.Yolanda is asking for this loan to be able to buy more merchandise (pants, shirts, blouses, baby clothes, etc.). This way, she can stock her store and continue to have better earnings to be able to keep maintaining financial security, as she has so far.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing).

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Doña Maribel de 46 años de edad se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años, es una mujer  muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijo. Desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en: Maribel is 46 years old. She has grown corn and beans for several years. She is very responsible with her home, as she has always been described as giving the best to her children. Right now, she lives with her husband and 5 children. She wants to increase her sales and to do that she has asked for a loan which will allow her to buy: seeds, fertilizer and more, so she can keep bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy farming materials.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: don José de 30 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos; él se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frijol y tiene de respaldo la siembra de café ya lleva varios años de trabajar en este rubro, el comercia en los alrededores de la zona. José es un hombre responsable y trabajador quiere aumentar sus ganancias pero necesita invertir en insumos por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizantes, herramientas, etc. y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: José is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children. He is a farmer and grows corn and beans. He also has the backup of a coffee crop. He has done this work for several years. He works on the outskirts of town. José is a responsible and hardworking man who wants to increase his earnings, but he needs to invest in materials. To do that he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizer, tools, etc., and thus give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming materials.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en: Jaqueline is 27 years old and single. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a food vending business selling foods such as viand in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional food to sell such as pork meat. Her plan is to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional food to sell such as pork meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build an enclosing wall.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 54 years old with three school aged children from the village of Ugad, in the province of Isabela. She is very patient person and she makes sure to do what she can to meet the needs of her family. And for that reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins to use in her hog raising business.
In the future, Lorna hopes that she can renovate their house to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to use in  her hog raising business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more drinking water.
Arlyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
NWTF is re-listing Arlyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more drinking water to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer's business is sari-sari store. She is 46 years old now and happily married with three children. Jenifer and her family live in the village of Caloacan. She has been in this business for 14 years and usually earns about PHP 300 a day. Jenifer is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy grocery items such as condiments, soap and beverages to sell. She hopes to grow her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as condiments, soap and beverages to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is 29 years old and married to a field technician that works for an agricultural company. The couple is blessed with two children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village and has done so for almost 9 years. In this business she's earning a net income of PHP 5,000 a month. She would like take out a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, and biscuits. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted immediately so that she can utilize it in her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, and biscuits.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 53 years old, and married with 3 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing so for over 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and now has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar and eggs. Her plan is to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 63 years old, widowed with eight children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, soap and eggs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, soap and eggs.

loans.name: Leonely

texts.en:
Leonely, 34 years old, is married to a farmer, and they are blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost three years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 2,500 a month. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, cooking oil, and detergent soaps. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize it in her business to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coffee, cooking oil, and detergent soaps.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a fish vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC since the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Shima Group

texts.fr:
Joséphine  fait partie du groupe Shima et   habite à Ruyigi. Elle  a 30 ans et est mariée à Déo, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants  dont 3 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…)  depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son  cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de nourrir la famille et payer les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Josephine is a member of the Shima group and lives in Ruyigi. She is 30 years old and is married to Deo, a driver. Together they have four children, of whom three go to school. 

Josephine has been selling goods (rice, beans, salt...) out of a shop for eight years. This is her fifth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large number of goods to resell in her shop, in order to earn more. 

The income from this business allows her to feed her family and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy goods to resell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 31 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Marcelina is diligent person, she makes sure that she can provide for the needs of her family. 

Marcelina is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, snack foods, spices and drinks for her store to have additional income so that she can give her family a good quality of living. She hope that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, spices and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: This time, Elma is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her meat-vending business. The soft-drinks retail business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, continue to provide Elma and her family the opportunity to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a hog-raiser in the village of Centro 1, Angadanan. He is 51 years old. He is happily married to Delia. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. 

As of now, Rolando wants to have more piglets to raise, but he lack the necessary capital. In this regard, Rolando is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional piglets to raise as well as the feed for them. He hopes that he can obtain his desired loan to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise as well as the feed for them.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   LAIDOU  est constitué de 4  femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Les sept  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de   fruits et légumes à l’image de KADIA qui est la présidente de l’association,  assise en première position de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de fruits et légumes  et compte acheter avec son  prêt,  2 paniers d’avocat avec les grossistes venant de la côte d’ivoire. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Laidou group is made up of four women, who are all married and who, on average, are 26 years old and have four children. They live in traditional, extended families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood in the town of Bougouni. They know each other through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their businesses, they joined the mico-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth loan. Their seven previous loans have all been correctly repaid. 

This group of women sells fruits and vegetables. Kadia, the president of the group, is the one seated first on the right in the photo. She buys and sells fruits and vegetables and hopes to buy two racks of avocados from the wholesalers coming from Côte d'Ivoire. She makes her sales in a market and from her home, for cash and credit to customers who are mostly women. 

Kadia hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which will be used to reinvest in the businesses and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 34 years old and is married to Herman, a father who is engaged inthe  agricultural business. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with four children. Aside from the agricultural business, Jonalyn is engaged in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for 15 years. She usually earns about 350 PHP a day. For this store, Jonalyn is asking a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, soap, beverages, assorted breads and condiments to sell. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap, beverages, assorted breads and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael tiene ya más de 08 años con su negocio de ferretería venta de productos para la construcción.  El señor Ismael es originario de esta ciudad y tiene cuatro hijos bajo su responsabilidad tres de ellos están estudiando y su hija la mayor es quien el ayuda atender el negocio, cuando el tiene que salir a comprar la mercancía o a las entregas de pedidos.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía ya que desea tener más producto para vender por mayoreo y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Con una parte de las ganancias del negocio será para pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
 Desea incrementar su negocio y que tenga más ingresos y con esta inversión su negocio tendrá más clientes y podrá tener los productos que ellos necesitan para realizar las mejoras a sus casas, ya que también quiere empezar a dar servicios de construcción a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ismael has had his hardware business selling construction products for more than eight years.  Ismael's a native of this city and has four children in his care.  Three of them attend school and his older daughter helps him attend to the business when he has to leave to buy merchandise or deliver orders.

He's requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise.  He wants to have more products to sell wholesale and he doesn't want to reduce the value of his business.

Part of the profit from his business will be to repay the loan, because it's a source of income for his family.

He wants to increase his business and have more income.  With this investment his business will have more customers and he'll be able to have the products they need to improve their homes.  He also wants to begin offering his customers construction services.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana Doris

texts.es: Doña Ana se dedia a la venta de comida en su lugar de residencia tiene muy buena clientela ya que ella los atiende muy bien y tiene todo tipo de comida, tambien vende comida por encargo, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, Doña Ana solicita un credito para poder comprar mas productos que le sirven para prepara su comida y para seguir obteniendo mas ganancias para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia junto con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana makes a living selling food at home.  She has good customers because she serves them very well and has all types of food.  She also sells food on order.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her son.

Ana's requesting a loan to be able to buy more products to prepare her dishes and continue getting more profit to give her family a better quality of life along with her husband.

loans.use: to buy products for selling food

loans.name: Behzod

texts.ru: Бехзоду 32 года. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, которая помогает ему введение бизнеса. Они не имеют детей. Бехзод более 15 лет занимается скотоводством и земледелием. Он в основном выращивает пшеницу, морковь и картофель. Другого источника дохода у него нет, так как он живет в сельской местности. В этом году не смог взять хороший урожай и поэтому он хочет дальнейшем развивать скотоводство, так как скотоводство имеет мало риска, чем земледелие. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bekhod is 32, and is married to a wonderful woman who helps him run his business. They don't have any children. Bekhod has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for more than 15 years. He mainly grows wheat, carrots, and potatoes. Because he lives in a rural area, this is his only source of income. This year he was unable to get a good harvest, and so he wants to expand the livestock side of the business, which is less risky than farming. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 2000 somons to buy cattle. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: 02.03.07 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hải has a business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase fabrics for her sewing business.

Hải is 30 years old and married with two children.

Hải is the group leader of the 02.03.07 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in the province of Thanh Hoa.

This is Hải's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Hải has been involved in this business for five years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hải hopes for her family to be healthy and happy. She also hopes for her children to do well in school and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for her sewing business.

loans.name: Marina Estela

texts.es: Doña Marina de 50 años de edas vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos los cuales 2 dependen de ella, es comerciante junto con su esposo tiene un puesto de comida desde hace 25 años cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene muy buena clientela, su hija sale a repartir los platos de comida que le encargan sus clientes, ella solicita credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y poder seguir adelante con su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marina, 50, lives with her husband and her three children, two of whom are dependent on her.  She and her husband are merchants.  She has had a food stall near her house for 25 years.  She has very good customers.  Her daughter goes out to distribute the plates of food that her customers order.

She's requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise so she can get ahead with her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for her restaurant

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 36 years old and married with two school-age children. Joel is a very hardworking father. He is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and piglets. Aside from his hog-raising business, he is also engaged in farming. Joel dreams that his business will expand some day so that he can provide everything that is family needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: 01.06.03 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to resell.

Nhung is 58 years old and married with three children.

Nhung is the group leader of the 01.06.03 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in the province of Thanh Hoa. She has no dependents since her children are grown up.

In 2006, Nhung joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her  business. Nhung has successfully repaid four loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Nhung has been involved in this business for four years.

The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy. She also hopes that her children will find good jobs and that her business will do well.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to resell.

loans.name: 01.12.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat to resell.

Tình is 49 years old and married with four children.

Tình is the group leader of the 01.12.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members.

She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in the province of Thanh Hoa. She has no dependents since her children are grown up.

This is Tình's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Tình has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Tình faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy. She also hopes that her children will find good jobs and that her business will do well.

loans.use: to purchase meat to resell.

loans.name: 02.03.07 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình works in agriculture. She farms poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Tình is 56 years old and married with two children.

Tình is the group leader of the 02.03.07 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in the province of Thanh Hoa. She has no dependents since her children are grown up.

In 2013, Tình joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her  business. Tình has successfully repaid one loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Tình has been involved in this business for two years.

The main hardship that Tình faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy. She also hopes that her children will find good jobs and that her business will do well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.ru: Боймурод житель Яванского района, который расположен в центральной части Таджикистана. Ему 36 лет. Он женат и у него шестеро детей. Двое из них учатся в школе. Его жена занимается растениеводством и разведением скотов. Боймурод очень скромный и трудолюбивый человек. У него среднее образование. Уже 8 лет как Боймурод занимается скотоводством. Это ремесло ему передано от дедушки. В деятельности ему помогают сыновья и брат. Боймурод запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. В дальнейшем за счет прибыли Боймурод планирует построить большой сарай для скота и сделать ремонт в своем новопостроенном доме.
texts.en: Boymurod lives in Yavan, which is in central Tadzhikistan. He is 36, married, and has six children. Two of his children are in school. His wife works in gardening and animal husbandry. Boymurod is a very modest, hardworking person. He has a high school education. Boymurod has been working in animal husbandry for 8 years. This trade was passed down to him from his grandfather. His sons and brother help him out with the business. Boymurod is seeking a loan to buy cattle for fattening and later resale. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to build a large barn for the cattle and repair his house.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Roxana Verónica

texts.es:
Doña Roxana es una microempresaria que tiene un tramo de venta de comida corriente y produce tortillas, este ultimo alimento elaborado con maíz y constituye un alimento de primera necesidad en la comida de los nicaragüenses.

Es una persona esforzada con sus metas bien definidas, ella empezó produciendo tortillas, luego descubre que a la vez podía vender comida corriente para el desayuno y el almuerzo, diversificando así su negocio ha mejorado significativamente la imagen de su punto de venta.

En su negocio empieza atender a sus clientes desde la siete de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde. 

En estos momentos necesita capital de trabajo para comprar maíz por quintales, ya que de esta forma los costos de producción se reducen.

Tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos en edad escolar, su estado civil es acompañada
texts.en:
Roxana is a micro businesswoman who has a stall where she sells fast food and makes tortillas.  She makes the tortillas from corn.  They are a staple food in Nicaragua.

Roxana is a hard-working woman who has well-defined goals.  She started out making tortillas then discovered that she could also sell fast food for breakfasts and lunches.  Diversifying her business in this manner has significantly improved the image of her sales location.

Roxana starts serving her customers at 7 o'clock in the morning and works until 4 o'clock in the afternoon.  Right now, she needs working capital in order to buy corn by the 100lb sack.  This enables her to reduce her production costs.

Roxana has three children, two of whom are school age.  She lives with her common-law husband.

loans.use: to buy 100lb sacks of corn, and firewood

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos es originario de una zona turística de la ciudad de san Rafael del  sur, donde la mayor parte de sus habitantes se dedican a la pesca artesanal, desde muy joven aprendió a pescar y desde entonces ha sido su fuente de trabajo.

Gracias a su esfuerzo en colaboración con su esposa tienen otro negocio de pulpería, en donde venden granos básicos, verduras, bebidas, carne, entre otras cosas.

Su negocio ha mejorado, al igual que su demanda por lo que necesita de un financiamiento para atender la demanda de sus clientes.

Su forma de venta es ambulante de casa en casa, además de vender en su punto de venta.
Es una persona honesta y emprendedora y capaz de aprovechar la oportunidad que se le brinde en su actividad comercial.

Su estado civil es casado, y tiene cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Carlos is from a tourist area in the city of San Rafael del Sur.  Most of the locals there are engaged in small-scale fishing.  Carlos learned to fish when he was very young and, since then, it has been a source of work for him.

Carlos and his wife both work hard.  In addition to the fish selling, they also have a grocery store business where they sell basic grains, vegetables, drinks, meat, etc.  Their business has improved, as has the demand for their goods.  They need a loan to meet their customers' demands.

Carlos sells his fish door to door.  He also sells from his sales location.

Carlos is an honest, entrepreneurial person who is capable of making the most of opportunities that present themselves in his commercial activities.

Carlos is married and has four school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy lobsters, shrimp and fish

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos es un microempresario que tiene el arte de trabajar en madera, produciendo una variedad de muebles como roperos, camas matrimoniales, sillas mecedoras.

Aprende el oficio de carpintería en talleres de la ciudad de san Rafael del sur, luego trabaja para algunos hoteles y restaurantes de la zona.

Posteriormente con sus ahorros logra comprar algunas herramientas eléctricas y manuales para poner su propio taller contiguo a su casa de habitación.

Por la calidad de su trabajo realiza mejoras en algunos establecimientos turísticos de la zona de pocho mil y masa chapa, estas son playas del pacifico nicaragüenses, además de encargos personales.   

Es una persona emprendedor capaz de crecer como comerciante, actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar madera de laurel y Guanacaste para atender unos encargos de sus clientes.

Su estado civil es casado y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Carlos is a small-business owner that possesses the skill of working wood, producing a variety of furniture, such as wardrobes, double beds, and rocking chairs. He learned the carpentry trade in workshops in the city of San Rafael del Sur. Later, he worked for some hotels and restaurants in the area.

Subsequently, with his savings, he was able to buy some power and hand tools to open his own workshop adjacent to his home. Because of the quality of his work, he builds improvements in some of the tourist establishments in the Pochomil and Masachapa areas, which are Nicaraguan beaches on the Pacific Ocean. He also does personal orders.

He is an enterprising person capable of growing as a merchant. Currently, he needs a loan to buy laurel and guanacaste wood to fill some of his customers’ orders.

He is married and has three children, one of which is school-aged.

loans.use: to invest the loan to purchase laurel and black guanacaste wood.

loans.name: 02.06.06 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quỳnh is 60 years old; she lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.  She is married with two grown children who are no longer dependent on her.

Quỳnh is the group leader of the 02.06.06  Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She has a retail business selling clothing, which she has been doing for three years. The main hardship that Quỳnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2011, Quỳnh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell. 

With her business profit, Quỳnh hopes her family will be healthy and happy, her children will find good jobs, and her business will do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза замужняя женщина с одним ребенком. Ее дочь в настоящее время учится в средней школе. Фирузе 54 года. Она со своей семьей проживает в городе Дангара. Фируза совместно с мужем работает в сфере торговли. У них имеется большой магазин на рынке города, где она с мужем занимается продажей сухофруктов и конфет. Фируза очень любит свой бизнес. Ее деятельность - это ее жизнь. Она в области торговли более 20 лет и не не может представить свою жизнь вне сферы торговли. Фируза берет кредит для закупа сухофруктов и конфет на продажу, с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Firuza is 54, married, and has one daughter who attends high school. She lives with her family in Dangara. Firuza runs a retail business together with her husband. They have a large store at the city market where they sell dried fruit and candy. Firuza really loves her business; it's her entire life. She and her husband have been doing this kind of work for more than 20 years and cannot imagine their lives doing anything else. Firuza is seeking a loan to purchase dried fruit and candy in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruit and candy in order to increase sales.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Doña María  es comerciante de cosméticos como; perfumes, cremas perfumada, champú, pintura labial y de uña, tiene cuatro años de ser vendedora de la marca avon.

Su forma de venta es por encargo, sin embargo tiene productos en su casa para la venta.

Se proyecta en crecer como emprendedora y en atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, por lo que necesita de la colaboración de kiva - ceprodel  para comprar un pedido de cosméticos.

Su idea de negocio nace después que queda en el desempleo, ella trabajaba para el banco nacional de desarrollo en el área de caja, y como una alternativa de ser un agente económico en su hogar decide comercializar cosméticos.

Es madre soltera, y tiene dos hijos uno de diecinueve y catorce años el menor.
texts.en:
María's business is selling cosmetics such as perfumes, scented creams, shampoo, lipsticks and nail polish.  She has been selling Avon products for four years now.

María makes her sales to order.  However, she also keeps products in her house to sell.

María plans to grow as a entrepreneur and serve a larger number of customers.  In order to achieve this, she needs the help of Kiva and Ceprodel to place an order for cosmetics.

María's business idea came about after she found herself unemployed.  She used to work as a teller in a national development bank and, in order to continue contributing financially to her household, she decided to start selling cosmetics.  

María is a single mother and has two children who are 19 and 14 years old.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, shampoo, lipstick, hair dye and scented creams

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es:
Doña Claudia es una emprendedora que se dedica a la compra y venta de celulares, además de vender recargas electrónicas en su punto de venta.

Necesita de una fuente de financiamiento para comprar un pedido de celulares y dar cobertura a unos encargos de sus clientes.

Ella inicia su negocio por iniciativa propia al descubrir que este producto tiene una gran demanda y constantemente se presentan nuevos modelos y diseños.

Es una persona honesta y con deseos de superación personal.
Su estado civil es soltera.
texts.en:
Claudia is an entrepreneur dedicated to purchasing and selling cellular phones, as well as selling prepaid cell phone cards in her store. She needs a financial source to purchase an order of cellular phones and to cover some of her customers’ orders. 

She began her business through her own initiative when she discovered that this product has a high demand, and that new models and designs are constantly appearing. She is an honest person who has dreams of personal self-improvement. She is single.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phones and prepaid cellular phone cards.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con su familia en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La V.R.C Mushuc Pakari está conformada por 10 socios se dedica a la agricultura a 40 minutos de la oficina.

María se dedica a vender legumbres. Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, habas y mellocos. Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como son vacas,cerdos. Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comparar fertilizantes, vacuna para los ganados . 
Con el crédito que le otorga la cooperativa podrá utilizarlo para la crianza de animales y mejorar las siembras. Realiza las compras en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es tener una casa propia y un negocio grande de venta de legumbres. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta en la vida son las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre se dedica a pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old, single, and lives with her family in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The Mushuc Pakari community bank has 10 members who are all farmers and live 40 minutes away from the office.

María's business is selling vegetables.  She grows potatoes, beans and melloco (a native root vegetable).  She also raises cows and pigs.

María will use her loan money to buy fertilizers, and vaccines for her livestock.  The loan will help her to raise her animals and improve her crops.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda canton. 

María's dream is to own her own home and to have a large vegetable business.  The challenges that she faces are pests that attack her crops.  In her free time, she enjoys being with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and animal vaccines

loans.name: Cisto

texts.es: Cisto de 43 años de edad se dedica a la carpinteria desde hace 15 años trabaja de lunes a sabado porque resive pedidos semanales de todo tipo(puertas, cuadros para fotos o diplomas, muebles, entre otras cosas) vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos (18, 15 y 2 años) en casa propia. Don Cisto solicita un credito para invertir en la compra de madera, cedro, laurel, pega, sellador, clavos, etc, y seguir con su negocio como lo ha hecho hasta el dia de hoy y asi obtener mejores ganancias para seguir llevando el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
43-year-old Cisto has been working as a carpenter for 15 years.  He works from Monday to Saturday and receives weekly orders for all types of products (doors, frames for photos or diplomas, furniture, etc.)  He lives with his wife and their three children, who are 18, 15 and 2 years old, in their own home.

Cisto is requesting this loan to invest in buying wood (cedar and laurel-tree wood), adhesive, sealant, nails, etc.  He hopes to continue working in his business as he has done up to now and to make better profits so that he can continue providing for his family on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials

loans.name: 04-01-02-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Lan is 56 years old, married, and has three adult children.. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling bread, which she has been doing for over 10 years.. 

Lan is the group leader of the 04-01-02-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women, which she will use to purchase rice and meat to make processed food to sell.

The main hardship Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice and meat. t

loans.name: Lesbia Yamileth

texts.es:
Doña Lesbia es originaria de una zona turística de la ciudad de san Rafael del  sur, donde la mayor parte de sus habitantes se dedican a la pesca artesanal, tiene quince años de vender mariscos y ha sido su fuente de trabajo con la que colabora dignamente en los gastos de su hogar.

Es importante mencionar que su esposo es pescador y a la vez vende pescado por encargos en algunos restaurantes de Managua.

Su negocio ha crecido y necesita mayor capital de trabajo para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Su forma de venta es ambulante de casa en casa, sin embargo en su casa de habitación tiene mariscos a la venta donde los almacene en un congelador.

Antes de tener su negocio era ama de casa, al descubrir la oportunidad de comercializar mariscos se dedica en atender su negocio personal.

Su estado civil es acompañada y tiene cinco hijos todos es edad escolar.
texts.en:
Lesbia is a native of a tourist area in the city of San Rafael del Sur, where the majority of the residents make a living in artisanal fishing.  She has sold shellfish for 15 years and it has been her source of work, giving her the dignity to help with the household expenses.  It's important to mention that her husband is a fisherman and also sells fish on order to some restaurants in Managua.

Her business has grown and she needs more working capital to satisfy customer demand.  She sells door-to-door on foot.  However, she also has shellfish for sale at her house, where she stores them in a freezer.

She was a housewife when she found out about the opportunity to sell shellfish, before she got her business.  She devotes herself to attending to her business on her own.  She's married and has five school-age children.

loans.use: to buy lobster, shrimp, and fish

loans.name: 04-04-03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to to purchase rice and meat to make processed food for resale.

Hòa is 40 years old and she is married with two children. Hòa is the group leader of the 04-04-03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents

In 2009, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hòa has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice and meat to make processed food for resale

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en: Jackelyn, 21 years old and single, comes from the village of Ugad, province of Isabela. She is a very young and hardworking person. She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 to buy feed and additional piglets for her business. According to her, she got into this business at a young age so that she can save money for her future and also, she can help her parents to provide for the daily needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Hamwani Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
David is a hard-working man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop along with farming to boost his income. Like most traders, he has challenges of price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes. 

David is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy general merchandise such as sugar, rice, and maize flour to sell. He is a member of the Hamwani Tweyimukye Group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. In the future, he hopes to expand his business to new areas and educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as sugar, rice, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 53 years old. He had three children, and he is a farmer. He is planting and harvesting rice to sell. He had been doing it for 10 years now and earns about 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month. It goes for meals, bills at home and revolving capital in the business. 

He is now asking for additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

Someday, a good harvest will help him achieve better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a 28-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda, with seven children; only two attend school. He has been a security officer for four years and works 12 hours a day. Unfavorable working conditions with low pay is his greatest challenge, and his desire is to educate his children so that they can have better jobs. Vicent intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is 51 years old, married and has children. He lives in a small town in the municipality of Tumuaini. He has always made a living in agriculture, growing basic grains like corn and rice. Twelve years ago he started growing these crops. He sells his goods at the local market. He decided to request a loan, which he plans to use to purchase fertilizers and manure for his crops and to pay for the labor to care for them. His goal is to expand his production and take in a better harvest so he can help pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure for his crops and to pay for the labor to care for them.

loans.name: Federick

texts.en: Federick is a 31-year-old married man with three children, living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. He is a laboratory assistant who works eight hours a day. He earns additional income from a retail business and farming. He has been working as a laboratory assistant for two years and he was inspired by his desire to serve in the medical department. He has a dream of educating his children to attain degrees, at a minimum and expanding his side businesses to new markets. Federick intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El Señor vive en Orquídeas (Guayaquil), el tiene 51 años edad.  El siempre ha sido albañil pero al enterarse de la enfermedad que es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida) cayó en una depresión, pero después pensó que la vida es una sola, y empezó a hacer su casa, y empezó a crecer con su profesión de albañil para disfrutar de la vida.

El realiza su trabajo de albañil solo, el realiza trabajo cuando lo buscan sus servicios,  así logra mantenerse.
A él le dificulta su trabajo en la edad, y en la mucha competencia que hay en la actualidad. El no está casado, no tiene hijos.

El usara el préstamo para comprar materiales para su trabajo como: palos, martillo, etc. Sus sueños son que nadie le dé la espalda por su enfermedad.
texts.en:
This man, age 51, lives in Orquídeas (Guayaquil).  He has always been a bricklayer.  However, upon contracting the illness, which is PVVS (patient living with HIV/AIDS), he fell into a depression.

However, after that he thought about having only one life.  He started to build his house, and he started to grow in his profession as a bricklayer in order to enjoy life.

He does his bricklaying work alone.  He works when his services are sought out, and that is how he manages to support himself.

Age makes his work difficult as well as the large amount of competition there is now.

He is not married, and he has no children.

He will use the loan to buy materials for his work like trowels and hammers, etc.

His dream is that no one turns their back on him because of his illness.

loans.use: to buy materials for his work like trowels and  hammers, etc.

loans.name: Rubén Antonio

texts.es:
Rubén Antonio habita en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, un bello y encantador Pueblo, donde existen diferentes actividades comerciales y ganadera.  

Rubén es Soltero con un hijo bajo su cargo Luchador por su vida y la de su hijo, se dedica a brindar sus servicios profesionales en uno de los centro de salud, donde su trabajo es técnico de vectores.

Hoy en día se vio la necesidad de querer obtener una viviendita en mejores condiciones con su familia, por lo que solicita a kiva y Ceprodel que le financien un crédito para la compra de: hierro Perlines y Zin, esto sería de gran aprovecho en poder empezar a mejorar su vivienda. 

Agradece a Kiva y Ceprodel que ayudan con crédito y que siempre piensan en las personas con deseo de vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Rubén Antonio lives in the beautiful, attractive town of Santa Rosa del Peñón whose inhabitants are engaged in a number of different commercial and farming activities.  

Rubén is single and has one son in his care.  He works hard for both himself and his son.  He provides professional services in a health center, working as a vector control technician.

Rubén would like to see his house in a better state of repair for the sake of his family.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel with which to buy iron, metal beams and sheets of corrugated metal.  This will prove very useful in enabling him to start improving his home.

Rubén thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for helping with a loan and for always thinking of people who want to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal beams and corrugated metal sheets

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a thirty-year-old married woman with three children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For ten years now she has been a teacher and her passion for teaching started way back in her secondary school days. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university despite challenges of inadequate capital due to her low monthly salary. In order to provide the basics for her family with ease, she now wants to start up a retail shop.

Gladys intends to use the money to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Nzanguma

texts.en: Nzanguma is a forty-year-old married man with four children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been in his boutique business since 2008. He began the business in order to get income to cater for his family. The purpose of the loan is to buy more clothes for resale. He hopes to build a permanent residential house for the family. His main challenge is customers taking clothes on credit and inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: 04-07-10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hưng has a business selling firewood. She is requesting a loan to purchase firewood for resale. Hưng is 54 years old and she is married with four children. Hưng is the group leader of the 04-07-10-Hạnh Phúc solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, as her children are grown up.

In 2011, Hưng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hưng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hưng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hưng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Using her business profit, Hưng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 50 years old, married and has four children. He and his wife manage a rice field to earn an income. His income of about PHP 10,000 each harvest season goes for meals and revolving capital for the farming business.
He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy insecticides and pesticides used in farming. It will help nourish his crops and will help earn more profits to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Tawakaal Credit & Savings Group

texts.en: Sebbi is a 56-year-old married man with 6 children living in Fort Portal ,Uganda. His main business is a retail shop but also earns a salary as a civil servant and by farming. Price fluctuation is his major challenge but he has a vision of becoming a prominent businessman in the region. Sebbi is requesting a loan to buy stock of plates, cups, forks and trays to sell. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of plates, cups, forks and trays to sell.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 55 years old, married, and has five children. Together, she and her husband keep improving crop production through fertilizers and insecticides that nourish crops. Her income of around P10,000 each harvest season is just enough to sustain the family's consumption and sometimes, they lack financially in sustaining their crops. 

Carmencita is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

With a plentiful harvest, Carmencita will be able to earn more profits that will help them upgrade the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, an enterprising man, is 59 years old and married. He currently lives with his parents and two siblings. He is asking for a loan with the dream of purchasing supplies and bags of seed in order to start his business, with the goal of harvesting part of the seedlings and selling the others to neighbors and to people in other communities nearby. The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of funds to begin the business. For that reason he is requesting a loan amounting Php 15,000. He hopes that he can expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loans.name: Rakerla

texts.en:
Rakerla and her spouse live in Iguig and they have a child. Rakerla is now 22 years old. Aside from growing rice, Rakerla also raises hogs to sell. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will nourish the rice crop from a half-hectare rice field they inherited from her parents.
Rakerla hopes to increase crop production and keep saving funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to be used for her rice crops.

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is 55 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business, selling motor spare parts and accessories in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns about 15,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, like motor spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like motor spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Gerivasio

texts.en: Gerivasio is a 45-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows tea but he also earns a salary as a civil servant. Unpredictable weather changes and high cost of farm inputs pose a challenge to his growth while his dream is to become the leading grower in the region. Gerivasio intends to use the loan to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land  for farming.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is married and has five children. He sells a variety of dry goods, which he has been doing for more than 10 years.  Danilo works every day from 6 AM to 6 PM.

Danilo is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which he will use to buy dry gods such as grocery items, school supplies, and plastic wares. His intention is to have a larger variety of products, to be able to offer more items to his customers, and to increase his sales for the future of his children. He wishes to save for their future in order to let his wife return from working in another country. He wants his family to stay together with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase dry gods such as grocery items, school supplies, and plastic wares.

loans.name: Emerito

texts.en:
Emerito is a farmer who hopes for good harvests in the farming business. He is 46 years old and has been planting and harvesting rice for over 10 years. He still aims for income increases because his income of about P10,000 every harvest is just not enough to maintain the farming business and to provide sustenance for his family. 

Emerito is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. This will help nourish his crops. In the future, he hopes to keep improving his farming practices and attain good yields every harvest season for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Khaladdin

texts.en:
Khaladdin is 32 years old and married with one son. He sells a variety of products such as sugar, sweets, dish washing soap and shampoo in his shop. His wife is a housekeeper. He has 10 years of experience in this field. People in the town are his regular customers who purchase food products and other available items at the store. His monthly profit from selling products is about 500 AZN.

His brother helps him sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location in the bazaar of his home city. Khaladdin wants to expand his business because this business is the only financial income in his family. For this purpose he applied for 1,500 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products. He has a good client history and this will be his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products to increase his profit.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino, tiene 60 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, el vive con su esposa en una aldea de Morazan, Yoro. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, su experiencia es de aproximadamente 30 años. Produce maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la comunidad. Don paulino ha solicitado ya un tercer préstamo que es por 3,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar abonos y va limpiar el terreno para volver a cultivar frijol. El préstamo le ayudara a cultivar mas parcelas que la cosecha anterior. Sus metas son hacer crecer los cultivos y cada vez obtener mas rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Paulino is 60 years old and is married with 3 grown-up children. He lives with his wife in Morazan, Yoro. 

He has worked continuously in agriculture for around 30 years. He grows corn and beans. 

He sells his produce in the community's local market. 

Paulino has requested his third loan, which amounts to 3,000 Honduran Lempiras, to buy fertilizer and clear the ground so he can cultivate beans again. 

The loan will help him to cultivate more plots that he has harvested previously. His aims are to produce more crops and obtain higher and higher profits.

loans.use: invest in preparing the ground to cultivate beans. He will buy fertilizer and pay for clearing the land.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 52 years old, married, and has children living with them at Iguig. The family's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. She has been doing this for over 10 years now and earns about P10,000 each harvest season (twice a year). It goes for meals, bills at home, revolving capital in the business and education fees. Her income is just enough but she wants to develop it so as to save funds for future expenses. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for cultivation. 

She hopes to keep harvesting good crops for the overall welfare of her family and income stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for cultivation

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar is a 52-year-old hardworking woman. She is a mother of 6 sons and daughters. To help in supporting her children Myassar started working in selling animals, specifically sheep and goats. She sometimes sells the milk she gets from the animals, too. Now Myassar is applying for a loan to buy more sheep and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 39-year-old married woman from the town of San Pablo in the Philippines. She has seven children. She earns a living through her hog raising business and her food vending business. She sells home cooked snack foods to the people in her village. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed for the pigs.

In the future, Eva hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is 36 years old and a conservative woman. She asked her husband Khaled to appear in the photo instead of her. They have one boy and one girl. Khaled has a small bookshop where he sells student and office supplies such as paper, pens, and other stationery items. He also has a small section where he sells some household products.

 Now Ola and her husband want to expand the business to increase the family income, so she applied for a loan to bring in more household products and increase the quantity of goods her husband has.

loans.use: to bring in more household products

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ces deux femmes faisant partie du Banc Villageois KANE-KANE habitent le même village. Elles vivent dans la bonne entente et la cohésion et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont l'embouche et le commerce.

Debout à droite de la photo, et levant la main la responsable, Seynabou est âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 garçons et une fille.

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète 10 fûts d'arachide à 25 000 frs l'unité qu'elle va transformer en huile et revendre. A la transformation elle obtient 40 litres d'huile par fût qu'elle revend à 1 000 frs. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité seront réinvestis dans l'activité et aussi dans la prise en charge des enfants par rapport à leurs scolarité, leur habillement et aide son mari dans dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
These two women are part of the "Banc Villageois" KANE-KANE, and live in the same village. They live in agreement with each other and form a cohesive unit. Their principal business is the fattening of livestock and trade. 

Standing on the right in the photograph with her hand raised is Seynabou, the 26-year-old leader of the group. She is married and the mother of 3 children, 2 boys and 1 girl. With the loan proceeds, she will buy 10 drums of groundnuts at 25,000 francs, which she will turn into oil and resell. She will be able to make 40 liters of oil, which she can resell at 1,000 francs each.

The profits generated by Seynabou's business will be reinvested in her business and also help to support her children in their schooling, their clothing, and to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts at the weekly markets to turn them into oil for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Butere, a small town in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Most farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Elizabeth is not married, and has been farming for two years. She is currently growing vegetables on her land. She is excited to work with Honey Care because the Hive Technicians will visit her farm regularly and do good work repairing the hives and harvesting honey. She also likes beekeeping because the bees do not require a big space on her farm. 

This is Elizabeth's first loan, and she plans to use the extra income generated from her hives to expand her farming activities.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina se dedica a la venta de  panes con jamon, queso, mayonesa, escabeche en un carreton desde hace 12 años en un lugar muy estrategico y muy transitado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza ha podido salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella vive con su mama y cuatro hermanos en casa propia. Reina a solicitado un credito para ampliar su negocio y poder reparar el carreton donde vende sus panes ya que lo tiene muy deteriorado y ese es su unica fuente de trabajo y con lo que le queda de ganacia no puede solventar ese gasto.
texts.en: Reina sells ham biscuits with cheese, mayonnaise, and pickles from a cart.  She’s been doing this for 12 years from a very strategic and well-travelled location near her home.  She has been able to get ahead with her household expenses through her sales and lives with her mother and four siblings in a home of her own.  Reina is asking for this loan in order to expand her business and so that she can repair the cart from which she sells her biscuits because this one is very run down and it’s her only source of work from which she earns a living.

loans.use: to repair her cart.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard lives in Butere, a small town in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Bernard is unmarried, and has been farming for three years. He is currently tending poultry, and plans to use the income from his hives to invest in and expand his poultry business. He is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because he trusts the Hive Technicians to visit his farm regularly and do good work repairing the hives and harvesting honey. Bernard likes beekeeping because it is convenient and the bees require little work. 

In the future, Bernard hopes to expand his businesses and become "economically stable".

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more thread and new embroidery tools.

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
